results.title: run 5: the journal of Strategic Studies Group [games magazine] Issue 5, January 1987
results.creator_credit: Strategic Studies Group and Ian Trout
results.brief_description:
Strategic Studies Group, commonly known as SSG, was an Australian software development company that primarily made strategy wargames. “Run5” was launched by SSG in January 1986.

Ian Trout had determined that print was the cheapest and most effective way to share new scenarios with the audiences for their games. In the editorial to the first edition Trout explains that print was much cheaper than creating disks which would “cost around $15 a pop”. As the son of a newspaper publishers and himself a bookshop proprietor Trout had a fondness for print publication and was interested in what SSG could achieve with its own magazine.

SSG was founded by strategy game enthusiasts Ian Trout and Roger Keating. Ian was proprietor of a military books store and Roger had had several of his games published by Strategic Simulations Inc. The game that launched the company was Reach for the Stars (1983). This games is credited for having “effectively launched the genre of 4-X space games - explore, expand, exploit, exterminate”. Its success was followed by a string of other, mostly historical military games published throughout the 1980s for Apple II, Atari, Commodore 64, and IBM PC series of computers. (some information for this entry dericed from Wikipedia)

results.title: Samson et Dalila
results.creator_credit: John Vernon, Elijah Moshinsky, Covent Garden Video Productions and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Camille Saint-Saens’ opera Samson et Dalila in three acts with libretto by Ferdinand Lemaire recorded live for television at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden. Based on Chapter 16 of the Book of Judges, this is the story of Samson (John Vickers), hero of the Israelites, and his betrayal by Dalila (Shirley Verrett). Features the Royal Opera Chorus and Orchestra of the Royal Opera House conducted by Sir Colin Davis, choreography by David Bintley and scenery and costume designed by Sidney Nolan. Cast also includes Jonathan Summers, Gwynne Howell, John Tomlinson, Maldwyn Davies, Matthew Best, John Dobson. Sung in French.

results.title: run 5: the journal of Strategic Studies Group [games magazine] Issue 2, April 1986
results.creator_credit: Strategic Studies Group and Ian Trout
results.brief_description:
Strategic Studies Group, commonly known as SSG, was an Australian software development company that primarily made strategy wargames. “Run5” was launched by SSG in January 1986.

Ian Trout had determined that print was the cheapest and most effective way to share new scenarios with the audiences for their games. In the editorial to the first edition Trout explains that print was much cheaper than creating disks which would “cost around $15 a pop”. As the son of a newspaper publishers and himself a bookshop proprietor Trout had a fondness for print publication and was interested in what SSG could achieve with its own magazine.

SSG was founded by strategy game enthusiasts Ian Trout and Roger Keating. Ian was proprietor of a military books store and Roger had had several of his games published by Strategic Simulations Inc. The game that launched the company was Reach for the Stars (1983). This games is credited for having “effectively launched the genre of 4-X space games - explore, expand, exploit, exterminate”. Its success was followed by a string of other, mostly historical military games published throughout the 1980s for Apple II, Atari, Commodore 64, and IBM PC series of computers. (some information for this entry dericed from Wikipedia)

results.title: Russia revisisted
results.brief_description: Moving beyond the popular images of ugly labour camps and frozen wastelands, Siberia in summer is stunningly beautiful as the inahabitants take advantage of the warm weeks. In St. Petersburg, we ride up the canals, incliding the famous Winter Canal. Joy turns to sadness as the mass war graves of half a million Russians who died during the seige of Leningrad in World War II, are visited. Filmed at the time of great change, this is a compelling insight into the lives of the soviets.

Ian Trout had determined that print was the cheapest and most effective way to share new scenarios with the audiences for their games. As the son of a newspaper publishers and himself a bookshop proprietor Trout had a fondness for print publication and was interested in what SSG could achieve with its own magazine.

SSG was founded by strategy game enthusiasts Ian Trout and Roger Keating. Ian was proprietor of a military books store and Roger had had several of his games published by Strategic Simulations Inc. The game that launched the company was Reach for the Stars (1983). This games is credited for having “effectively launched the genre of 4-X space games - explore, expand, exploit, exterminate”. Its success was followed by a string of other, mostly historical military games published throughout the 1980s for Apple II, Atari, Commodore 64, and IBM PC series of computers. (some information for this entry dericed from Wikipedia)

“Run5” was launched by SSG in January 1986.

results.title: Samson and Delilah
results.creator_credit: Cecil B. DeMille and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Cecil B. De Mille’s famous epic style is highlighted in this classic bible story about the legendary strongman Samson and the temptress Delilah, who helped destroy him. Lauded for its lush cinematography, performances, costumes, sets and special effects, it was a box office smash.

constellations_other.name: Swords, sandals and lightning bolts
constellations_other.description: In Thor: Love and Thunder, Russell Crowe plays one of the most recogniseable gods in the pantheon – Zeus. His scenes lampoon his Oscar-winning role in Gladiator, one of the most recognised films in a classic genre.

constellations_other.name: Religion, cinema and censorship
constellations_other.description: Religious narratives and themes have a complicated relationship with censorship, with creators pushing the boundaries for better or worse.

results.description: Cecil B. De Mille’s famous epic style is highlighted in this classic Bible story about the legendary strongman Samson, and the temptress Delilah, who seduced, betrayed and helped to destroy him. Victor Mature is the classic Samson; strong, brave and fearless as he wrestles lions and Philistines bare-handed. Hedy Lamarr is stunning as Delilah; in an array of dazzling and seductive costumes. Action packed, this Biblical epic is a spectacle to enjoy. Also stars George Sanders and Angela Lansbury.
description_for_label: Cecil B. Victor Mature is the classic Samson; strong, brave and fearless as he wrestles lions and Philistines bare-handed. Hedy Lamarr is stunning as Delilah; in an array of dazzling and seductive costumes. Action packed, this Biblical epic is a spectacle to enjoy. Also stars George Sanders and Angela Lansbury.

results.title: Sammy and Rosie get laid
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Sarah Radclyffe, Tim Bevan and Sammy and Rosie Ltd
results.brief_description: With relentless momentum director Stephen Frears unfolds the story of Sammy the hedonistic, thoroughly English, son of a prominent Pakistani politician, who abandoned the young man and his mother in London years before to seek wealth and power in his homeland. Sammy, who scrapes out a living as an accountant, lives in a dangerous and decaying black neighbourhood with his wife Rosie, a sexually adventurous “modern woman” supportive of fashionable radical issues. Theirs is an open marriage based on, as Rosie puts it, “freedom plus commitment”. Change enters their lives with the arrival of Rafi, Sammy’s long lost father who has been forced to flee his political enemies in Pakistan. Struggling to maintain his self-dignity and his sanity in the terrifying environment of the city he no longer knows, Rafi rapidly becomes disenchanted by Sammy and Rosie’s unanchored world and tolerance of sexual liberty, drugs and revolutionary violence. As the demons of his past return to haunt Rafi, escape is impossible; personal tragedy is inevitable.

results.title: Russell Drysdale
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Five Australians”.
This film shows personal interviews between Russell Drysdale and Australian author George Johnston. Their discussions centre on Drysdale’s slowly developing portrait of Johnston and closely examine the values and lifestyle of what Sidney Nolan calls “the most Australian painter”. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Rupert Murdoch
results.creator_credit: Ken Hannam, Kip Porteous and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Five Australians”
Looks at the personal life of Rupert Murdoch the newspaper tycoon, whose career started when he inherited the family company interests. He expanded the business and launched a national paper, The Australian. Members of his family and staff discuss the man they know.
